definitions.definition: To discharge ; to end the employment or service of.
examples: The company dismissed me after less than a year.
The soldiers were dismissed after the parade.

definitions.definition: To dispel ; to rid one’s mind of.
examples: He dismissed all thoughts of acting again.

definitions.definition: To reject ; to refuse to accept .
To invalidate ; to treat as unworthy of serious consideration.
examples: By telling the victim to "get over it", the listener dismissed the victim's feelings.

definitions.definition: To send or put away , to discard with disregard, contempt or disdain. (sometimes followed by as ).
examples: She dismissed him with a wave of the hand.

definitions.definition: To give someone a red card ; to send off .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To discharge ; to end the employment or service of.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To dispel ; to rid one’s mind of.
( transitive ) To reject ; to refuse to accept .
( transitive ) To invalidate ; to treat as unworthy of serious consideration.
( transitive ) To send or put away , to discard with disregard, contempt or disdain. (sometimes followed by as ).
( transitive , cricket ) To get a batsman out.
( transitive , sports , soccer ) To give someone a red card ; to send off .
